Ah, thanks Greg. For many settings I often mix up low quality vs high quality limits (is -ds 1 really good? or is it -ds .01 that's really good?...)


Your reminder got me on the right track, and -ds did in fact solve the reflected source issues:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/as336wx434x1gbi/reflection_ds.JPG?dl=0


For my future search of this question on the archives - when simulating reflected linear electric sources, set -ds to .1 or less (but not 0)!


Mike
